Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Nomogram-Based Prediction Model for Epistaxis Risk Following Nasotracheal Intubation

Participants.evidence: A total of 640 adult patients were initially considered, with 574 meeting eligibility criteria.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to identify risk factors for epistaxis following NTI and develop a nomogram-based prediction model.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the occurrence of epistaxis immediately after NTI, assessed using a video laryngoscope.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The model's AUC was 0.957 in the training set and 0.900 in the validation set.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial is registered with the Chinese Clinical Trial Center (No. ChiCTR2500097696).
